subject: p11413236
History: Mast cell activation syndrome with shortness of breath.
Findings: In comparison with study of, there has been the development of areas of opacification at the left base most likely reflecting atelectasis and mild effusion. In the appropriate clinical setting, supervening pneumonia would have to be considered. Port-A-Cath remains in place.
